org.openmuc.jdlms.client
Interface IClientConnection

public interface IClientConnection

This interface is the central user API to communicate over DLMS/Cosem. Each instance of this interface is a single connection to another smart meter.

Method Detail

connect

void connect(long timeout)
             throws java.io.IOException
Connects to the remote smart meter specified at the construction of the communication object. This method returns after the connection has been successfully established and authentication is completed Use this method only if ClientConnectionSettings.Authentication.LOWEST Authentication is used

Parameters:
timeout - Amount of milliseconds waited before the connection is aborted
Throws:
java.io.IOException

connect

void connect(long timeout,
             byte[] secret)
             throws java.io.IOException
Connects to the remote smart meter specified at the construction of the communication object. This method returns after the connection has been successfully established and authentication is completed Use this method if ClientConnectionSettings.Authentication.LOW, ClientConnectionSettings.Authentication.HIGH_MD5 or ClientConnectionSettings.Authentication.HIGH_SHA1 Authentication is used. Passing null as second argument results in the same behavior as calling connect(long) directly.

Parameters:
timeout - Amount of milliseconds waited before the connection is aborted
secret - Password to access smart meter, null if no password needed
Throws:
java.io.IOException

connect

void connect(long timeout,
             byte[] secret,
             HlsSecretProcessor processor)
             throws java.io.IOException
Connects to the remote smart meter specified at the construction of the communication object. This method returns after the connection has been successfully established and authentication is completed Use this method only if ClientConnectionSettings.Authentication.HIGH_MANUFACTORER Authentication is used. Passing null as third argument results in the same behavior as calling connect(long, byte[]) directly.

Parameters:
timeout - Amount of milliseconds waited before the connection is aborted
secret - Password to access the remote smart meter
processor - Object used to process the received server to client challenge combined with the afore-mentioned password
Throws:
java.io.IOException

disconnect

void disconnect()
Convenience method to call disconnect(true)

See Also:
disconnect(boolean)

disconnect

void disconnect(boolean sendDisconnectMessage)
Disconnects connection to remote smart meter

Parameters:
sendDisconnectMessage - If a message to release the connection shall be sent to the remote client. This parameter must be true on connectionless lower layer protocols (e.g. UDP) or if you want to give the remote end point a chance to gracefully close the connection

get

java.util.List<GetResult> get(long timeout,
                              GetRequest... params)
                              throws java.io.IOException
Convenience method to call get(timeout, false, params)

Parameters:
timeout - Amount of milliseconds waited before the request is aborted
params - Varargs of specifiers which attributes to send (See GetRequest)
Returns:
List of results from the smart meter in the same order as the requests
Throws:
java.io.IOException

                              boolean highPriority,
                              GetRequest... params)
                              throws java.io.IOException
Requests the remote smart meter to send the values of one or several attributes

Parameters:
timeout - Amount of milliseconds waited before the request is aborted
highPriority - Sends this request with high priority, if supported
params - Varargs of specifiers which attributes to send (See GetRequest)
Returns:
List of results from the smart meter in the same order as the requests
Throws:
java.io.IOException

set

java.util.List<AccessResultCode> set(long timeout,
                                     SetRequest... params)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
Convenience method to call set(timeout, false, params)

Parameters:
timeout - Amount of milliseconds waited before the request is aborted
params - Varargs of specifier which attributes to set to which values (See SetRequest)
Returns:
List of results from the smart meter in the same order as the requests or null if confirmed has been set to false on creation of this object. A true value indicates that this particular value has been successfully set
Throws:
java.io.IOException

set

java.util.List<AccessResultCode> set(long timeout,
                                     boolean highPriority,
                                     SetRequest... params)
                                     throws java.io.IOException

Parameters:
timeout - Amount of milliseconds waited before the request is aborted
params - Varargs of specifier which attributes to set to which values (See SetRequest)
highPriority - Sends this request with high priority, if supported
Returns:
List of results from the smart meter in the same order as the requests or null if confirmed has been set to false on creation of this object. A true value indicates that this particular value has been successfully set
Throws:
java.io.IOException

Parameters:
timeout - Amount of milliseconds waited before the request is aborted
params - List of specifier which methods to be called and, if needed, what parameters to call (See MethodRequest
highPriority - Sends this request with high priority, if supported
Returns:
List of results from the smart meter in the same order as the requests or null if confirmed has been set to false on creation of this object
Throws:
java.io.IOException

registerEventListener

void registerEventListener(IEventListener listener)
Register an EventListener on this connection. All future events coming from the remote smart meter will be forwarded to that EventListener. If another EventListener is already registered, this method may throw a runtime exception.

Parameters:
listener - The EventListener to register

removeEventListener

void removeEventListener(IEventListener listener)
Remove an EventListener from this connection. Call this method if you don't want to receive future events coming from the remote smart meter

Parameters:
listener - The EventListener to remove

isConnected

boolean isConnected()
Checks if the connection to the remote smart meter is established

Returns:
true if the connection is active
